Arithmetic mean is the average of a set of numbers. It is calculated by adding all the numbers in the set and then dividing the sum by the number of numbers in the set. For example, if the set of numbers is 2, 4, 6, and 8, the arithmetic mean is (2 + 4 + 6 + 8) / 4 = 5.5. The arithmetic mean is also known as the mean, average, or expected value. It is the most commonly used measure of central tendency.
